item.title: Bulletin updated at 02:02 HKT 28/06/2023
item.description:
At 2 a.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 29 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 91 per cent

The tropical disturbance over the northeastern part of the South China Sea has entered 800 kilometres of Hong Kong. The disturbance is expected to remain as a relatively weak system and will edge closer to the coast of southern China on Thursday (29 June), bringing showers and thunderstorms to the region. The Observatory will closely monitor the disturbance and assess its chance of developing into a tropical cyclone.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The public should beware of heat stroke and drink more water.
